info.title: IotCentralClient
info.description: Use this API to manage IoT Central Applications in your Azure subscription.

get.description: Lists all of the available IoT Central application REST API operations.
Get all IoT Central Applications in a subscription.

200.description: This is a synchronous operation. The body contains a JSON-serialized array of the metadata from all the IoT Central Applications in the subscription.
The body contains all the IoT Central application templates.

post.description: Check if an IoT Central application name is available.

requestBody.description: Set the name parameter in the OperationInputs structure to the name of the IoT Central application to check.

200.description: This is a synchronous operation. The body contains a JSON-serialized response that specifies whether the IoT Central application name is available. If the name is not available, the body contains the reason.

post.description: Check if an IoT Central application subdomain is available.

requestBody.description: Set the name parameter in the OperationInputs structure to the subdomain of the IoT Central application to check.

200.description: This is a synchronous operation. The body contains a JSON-serialized response that specifies whether the IoT Central application subdomain is available. If the subdomain is not available, the body contains the reason.

get.description: Get all the IoT Central Applications in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

200.description: This is a synchronous operation. The body contains a JSON-serialized array of the metadata from all the IoT Central Applications in the resource group.

get.description: Get the metadata of an IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The ARM resource name of the IoT Central application.

200.description: The body contains all the non-security properties of the IoT Central application. Security-related properties are set to null.

put.description: Create or update the metadata of an IoT Central application. The usual pattern to modify a property is to retrieve the IoT Central application metadata and security metadata, and then combine them with the modified values in a new body to update the IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The ARM resource name of the IoT Central application.

requestBody.description: The IoT Central application metadata and security metadata.

200.description: This is returned as a response to the status polling request for the create or update operation. The body contains the resource representation that indicates a transitional provisioning state.

201.description: This is returned as a response to the status polling request for the create or update operation. The body contains the resource representation that indicates a transitional provisioning state.

202.description: Accepted - Put request accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The ARM resource name of the IoT Central application.

200.description: This is returned as a response to the status polling request for the delete operation. The body contains the resource representation that indicates a transitional provisioning state.

202.description: Accepted - Delete request accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Once the long running delete operation completes successfully, a 204 No Content status code is returned when the status polling request finds the IoT Central application metadata in the service and the status of the delete operation is set to a completed state.

patch.description: Update the metadata of an IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The ARM resource name of the IoT Central application.

requestBody.description: The IoT Central application metadata and security metadata.

200.description: This is returned as a response to the status polling request for the create or update operation. The body contains the resource representation that indicates a transitional provisioning state.

202.description: Accepted - Put request accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously.

nameAvailable.description: The value which indicates whether the provided name is available.

AppAvailabilityInfo.description: The properties indicating whether a given IoT Central application name or subdomain is available.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of IoT Central Applications.

value.description: A list of IoT Central Applications.

AppListResult.description: A list of IoT Central Applications with a next link.

AppPatch.description: The description of the IoT Central application.

displayName.description: The display name of the application.

template.description: The ID of the application template, which is a blueprint that defines the characteristics and behaviors of an application. Optional; if not specified, defaults to a blank blueprint and allows the application to be defined from scratch.

AppProperties.description: The properties of an IoT Central application.

AppSkuInfo.description: Information about the SKU of the IoT Central application.

order.description: The order of the template in the templates list.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of IoT Central application templates.

value.description: A list of IoT Central Application Templates.

AppTemplatesResult.description: A list of IoT Central Application Templates with a next link.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

target.description: The target of the particular error.

OperationDisplay.description: The object that represents the operation.

name.description: The name of the IoT Central application instance to check.

type.description: The type of the IoT Central resource to query.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of IoT Central description objects.

value.description: A list of operations supported by the Microsoft.IoTCentral resource provider.

OperationListResult.description: A list of IoT Central operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

Resource.description: The common properties of an ARM resource.

resourceGroupName.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group that contains the IoT Central application.

resourceName.name: resourceName
resourceName.description: The ARM resource name of the IoT Central application.
